info: Choose what kinda application you wanna make:

currentContent.name: Web App
currentContent.description: This is a web app

currentContent.name: Mobile App
currentContent.description: This is a mobile app

currentContent.name: Desktop App
currentContent.description: This is a desktop app

currentContent.name: HTML
currentContent.description: Fundamental language for structuring web pages and content.

currentContent.name: CSS
currentContent.description: Language used for styling and designing websites.

currentContent.name: JavaScript
currentContent.description: Interactive language for adding dynamic elements to web pages.

currentContent.name: TypeScript
currentContent.description: Superset of JavaScript offering enhanced predictability and maintainability for large projects.

currentContent.name: React.js
currentContent.description: React.js is library for building user interfaces with a component-based approach.

currentContent.name: Vue.js
currentContent.description: Vue.js progressive JavaScript framework known for its simplicity and flexibility.

currentContent.name: Angular.js
currentContent.description: Angular.js is comprehensive framework for building applications with features like components, routing, and state management.

currentContent.name: Netlify
currentContent.description: Netlify is a simple and powerful hosting service for static sites, CI/CD workflows, and more.

currentContent.name: Heroku
currentContent.description: Heroku is a platform providing an easy way to deploy frontend and backend applications.

currentContent.name: Vercel
currentContent.description: Vercel is a service offering quick and easy deployment for frontend applications, especially Next.js apps.

currentContent.name: JavaScript/Node.js
currentContent.description: Javascript/Node.js is a popular language for backend development leveraging the V8 JavaScript engine. Node.js enables fast and scalable server development.

currentContent.name: Python
currentContent.description: Python is a versatile language widely used in backend development with frameworks like Django and Flask.

currentContent.name: Java
currentContent.description: Java is a Robust language used extensively in enterprise-level backend applications often with Spring Framework.

currentContent.name: Django
currentContent.description: Django is a Python-based web framework for building secure and scalable web applications.

currentContent.name: Flask
currentContent.description: Flask a lightweight Python web framework providing a flexible and easy way to build web apps.

currentContent.name: Express.js
currentContent.description: Express.js is a lightweight and flexible web framework for Node.js, offering essential tools for backend development like routing and middleware features.

currentContent.name: Heroku
currentContent.description: Heroku is a platform offering an easy way to deploy both frontend and backend applications.

currentContent.name: Amazon Web Services (AWS)
currentContent.description: Amazon Web Services (AWS) is a cloud platform providing a wide range of services including EC2 (Elastic Compute Cloud) for hosting backend applications.

currentContent.name: Microsoft Azure
currentContent.description: Microsoft Azure is a cloud platform offering hosting services for various backend applications like Azure App Service.

currentContent.name: MySQL
currentContent.description: MySQL is a relational database management system. It's commonly used in applications requiring structured data storage and complex relationships, such as e-commerce platforms, financial systems, and content management systems.

currentContent.name: PostgreSQL
currentContent.description: PostgreSQL is an advanced open-source relational database. It's preferred for applications demanding robustness, extensibility, and support for complex queries and data types, often utilized in data warehousing, analytical workloads, and large-scale applications.

currentContent.name: MongoDB
currentContent.description: MongoDB is a NoSQL document-oriented database system. It's typically used in projects handling unstructured or rapidly evolving data models, including real-time analytics, content management systems, and applications with high scalability requirements.
